intro: Armeria tenorei, commonly known as the Sicilian thrift, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant features dense clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its foliage consists of narrow, silver-gray leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Armeria tenorei is well adapted to rocky and arid environments, making it a hardy and drought-tolerant species.
